title: Pokémon: Indigo League
description: It’s Ash Ketchum’s tenth birthday, and he’s ready to do what many 10-year-olds in the Kanto region set out to do—become a Pokémon Trainer! Things don’t go exactly the way he planned when he ends up with a Pikachu rather than one of the usual first partner Pokémon, and winning Gym badges turns out to be much tougher than he thought. Luckily, he’s got former Gym Leaders Brock and Misty at his side, along with a bevy of new Pokémon friends, including Bulbasaur, Squirtle, and Charmander.

media.title: Pokémon - I Choose You!
media.description: Ash Ketchum, a 10-year-old from Pallet Town, is finally old enough to receive his first Pokémon! However, he oversleeps, and the only remaining Pokémon at Professor Oak’s lab is a strong-willed Pikachu!

media.title: Pokémon Emergency
media.description: Ash rushes into Viridian City with his wounded Pikachu, where he encounters Jessie, James, and Meowth of Team Rocket, as well as Misty, who’s angry about Ash wrecking her bike!

media.title: Ash Catches a Pokémon
media.description: Ash discovers and catches his first Pokémon! Though he’s excited, Misty is grossed out by his new Bug-type Pokémon friend.

media.title: Challenge of the Samurai
media.description: An angry swarm of Beedrill attacks Ash and Samurai in the midst of a Metapod standoff! Ash flees, leaving behind his Metapod, who is mad at him for abandoning it.

media.title: Showdown in Pewter City
media.description: Ash challenges the Pewter City Gym Leader, Brock, but even Pikachu has no chance against Brock’s Rock-type Pokémon. With the mysterious Flint helping him, it’s time for Ash to train hard before the rematch!

media.title: Clefairy and the Moon Stone
media.description: A scientist leads Ash and his friends deep into Mt. Moon to find the storied Moon Stone, which is said to increase the power of Pokémon!

media.title: The Water Flowers of Cerulean City
media.description: Ash seeks the Cascade Badge in Cerulean City—but for some reason, Misty doesn’t want to join him.

media.title: The Path to the Pokémon League
media.description: After earning his second badge, Ash sets off triumphantly for Vermilion City. Along the way, he hears of AJ, a Trainer on the brink of 100 straight victories. Full of confidence, Ash challenges this fearsome Trainer!

media.title: The School of Hard Knocks
media.description: Ash meets some students, who are bullying their classmate Joe. Joe insists the rough treatment is necessary so he’ll be strong enough to graduate. Ash doesn’t agree.

media.title: Bulbasaur and the Hidden Village
media.description: Completely lost, our heroes reach a village not shown on their map. This quiet place is inhabited by Pokémon that have been injured in battle or abandoned by their Trainers.

media.title: Charmander—the Stray Pokémon
media.description: As our heroes press on toward Vermilion City, they encounter an injured Charmander, sitting atop a stone on a mountain pass. They later find out why it is waiting there.

media.title: Here Comes the Squirtle Squad
media.description: Ash and his friends walk along a path and fall into a hole dug by a group of mischievous Squirtle. Why is the Squirtle Squad such a menace to the local population?

media.title: Mystery at the Lighthouse
media.description: The party meets Bill, a Pokémon researcher who is waiting in his lighthouse for the coming of a one-of-a-kind Pokémon, never before seen by humans. Could such a Pokémon truly exist?

media.title: Electric Shock Showdown
media.description: Eager to earn a badge, Ash challenges Lt. Surge. Pikachu reluctantly enters the battle, only to discover that its opponent is a Raichu, a fierce Pokémon with tremendous electric power—and the evolved form of Pikachu!

media.title: Battle aboard the St. Anne
media.description: Ash and his friends board the cruise ship St. Anne, thanks to tickets provided by Jessie and James in disguise. Their latest plan is to lure Pokémon Trainers onto the ship and steal their Pokémon!

media.title: Pokémon Shipwreck
media.description: A powerful storm forces everyone except Team Rocket and our heroes to abandon the sinking St. Anne. Ash, Brock, and Misty are forced to team up with their long-standing enemies in order to survive this sticky situation!

media.title: Island of the Giant Pokémon
media.description: As our heroes and Team Rocket beat the odds by surviving the sinking of the St. Anne, they are dragged into another perilous situation when they are attacked by the Pokémon, Gyarados!

media.title: Tentacool & Tentacruel
media.description: When a group of Tentacool interferes with the construction of a hotel, a woman offers a reward to anyone who can repel them. However, our heroes are forced into action when Team Rocket’s ploy fails spectacularly!

media.title: The Ghost of Maiden’s Peak
media.description: Our heroes arrive at a small port town, in the middle of celebrating a summer festival. To recover from their hard journey, Ash and his friends decide to relax and enjoy the festivities.

media.title: Bye-Bye Butterfree
media.description: When the party sees a group of Butterfree flying above the ocean, Ash decides to release his own Butterfree. After being rejected once, can Ash’s Butterfree win over the heart of its pink sweetheart?

media.title: Abra and the Psychic Showdown
media.description: The party finally arrives in Saffron City, where a young girl commands a Pokémon Gym with her psychic powers. If Ash defeats Gym Leader Sabrina, he will earn his fourth Gym badge!

media.title: The Tower of Terror
media.description: After being defeated by Sabrina, Ash realizes that he must catch a Ghost-type Pokémon to defeat the Saffron Gym Leader’s awesome Psychic-type Pokémon. He heads for Pokémon Tower in Lavender Town, where they are said to dwell.

media.title: Haunter vs. Kadabra
media.description: Leaving Pokémon Tower with Haunter in tow, Ash returns to Saffron City with only one goal in mind: to win a Gym Badge from the powerful Psychic-type Gym Leader, Sabrina!

media.title: Primeape Goes Bananas
media.description: When Ash tries to catch a wild Mankey, it loses its cool and uses Thrash on the whole gang—even stealing Ash’s hat! Will Ash find a way to pacify this pugnacious Pokémon?

media.title: Pokémon Scent-sation!
media.description: After insulting Gym Leader Erika’s perfume at a department store, Ash must go to some outrageous lengths to even set foot in the Celadon Gym, let alone be deemed worthy to challenge her!

media.title: Hypno’s Naptime
media.description: Officer Jenny reveals that a mysterious sleep wave has been detected in the area for several days. Our heroes suspect this has something to do with why so many children have gone missing, and why the Pokémon at the Pokémon Center arent getting better

media.title: Pokémon Fashion Flash
media.description: At Brock’s persistent request, our heroes stop by a well-known place  to Pokémon breeders for its Pokémon beauty salons.

media.title: The Punchy Pokémon
media.description: Outside Fuchsia City, our heroes come across Hitmonchan, a Fighting-type Pokémon. With little thought, Ash attempts to battle it, but he and Pikachu are quickly defeated. But who is the mysterious Trainer of this extraordinary Hitmonchan?

media.title: Sparks Fly for Magnemite
media.description: When a blackout plunges Gringey City into darkness, Ash and friends go to investigate the nearby power plant, where they find Magnemite and a host of Grimer. Could they be responsible for the city’s power outage?

media.title: Dig Those Diglett!
media.description: Ash, Brock, Misty, and Pikachu are lost deep in the mountains. As they press on through a rough track that doesn’t show up on their map, they suddenly hear a large explosion!

media.title: The Ninja Poké-Showdown
media.description: On his way to the next Gym Battle challenge but seemingly lost, Ash and friends arrive at a huge mansion that appears to be a hidden ninja’s lair! Could this be the Fuchsia Gym?

media.title: The Flame Pokémon-athon!
media.description: In the place of the injured Lara, can Ash handle her fiery Ponyta and guide it to win the annual race?

media.title: The Kangaskhan Kid
media.description: Our heroes accompany Officer Jenny into the forest, intent on pursuing some poachers. Soon, they discover a young boy amidst a pack of Kangaskhan. His name is Tommy, and no one knows the secret of his childhood…

media.title: The Bridge Bike Gang
media.description: After they encounter a very long bridge that can be only crossed by bike, a job delivering medicine is just the ticket for Ash and friends to reach Sunnytown!

media.title: Ditto’s Mysterious Mansion
media.description: Caught in a sudden rain shower, our heroes quickly try to seek some shelter. Dragging a very reluctant Misty, Ash and Brock go inside a cabin, and instantly get the impression that they are not alone!

media.title: Pikachu’s Goodbye
media.description: The gang discovers a large group of wild Pikachu, and though they first seem frightened by the intruder, the group eventually opens up to Ash’s Pikachu. How will Pikachu feel seeing others of its kind in the wild?

media.title: The Battling Eevee Brothers
media.description: Ash and friends find a huge home with a lavish garden party in full swing, attended by the Trainers of Pokémon that evolve using Evolution stones. Maybe they can find the seemingly abandoned Eevee’s Trainer here?

media.title: Wake Up Snorlax!
media.description: Our hungry heroes arrive at a small village. In return for a meal, Ash, Misty, and Brock agree to investigate what is causing the river to dry up, destroying the village’s harvest.

media.title: Showdown at Dark City
media.description: We join our heroes on the outskirts of Dark City, which appears to be deserted. Even during the middle of the day, there is no one on the streets. What has happened to make this place so desolate?

media.title: The March of the Exeggutor Squad
media.description: Ash is hard at work, continuing his rigorous training schedule even over spring vacation—until our heroes discover there’s a traveling carnival nearby! Ash, Misty, and Brock quickly join in the fun of the fair!

media.title: The Problem with Paras
media.description: Still in hot pursuit of our heroes, Team Rocket is ready to make yet another attempt to catch Pikachu—until disaster strikes! It soon becomes apparent that Meowth is getting sick!

media.title: The Song of Jigglypuff
media.description: Putting her idea of catching Jigglypuff aside for now, Misty promises to find a solution to this Pokémon’s singing situation!

media.title: Attack of the Prehistoric Pokémon
media.description: According to Ash’s rival Gary, fossils from extinct Pokémon have been discovered in the area, triggering a great fossil rush in the canyon. Ash decides to join in the excavation as a chance to beat Gary!

media.title: A Chansey Operation
media.description: Ash is sleeping peacefully until he is awoken by Brock and Misty with alarming news: there’s something wrong with Pikachu’s voice! Worried, Ash runs off with Pikachu in search of the nearest Pokémon Center.

media.title: Holy Matrimony!
media.description: As our heroes are walking in the countryside, they notice a “Missing Persons” poster of an undeniably familiar face: it looks exactly like James from Team Rocket! Is it really him in the poster?

media.title: So Near Yet So Farfetch’d
media.description: Our heroes discuss the rumor that a rare wild Farfetch’d has been seen in the area. Ash and Misty both vow to catch it, and soon they get their chance when the Pokémon appears!

media.title: Who Gets to Keep Togepi?
media.description: On leaving the Pokémon Center, our heroes discuss what they think will hatch from the Pokémon Egg Ash discovered. Nearby, Team Rocket begins hatching another daring plan to make it theirs!

media.title: Bulbasaur’s Mysterious Garden
media.description: During a battle with another Trainer’s Rhyhorn, the bulb on Bulbasaur’s back begins to glow, prompting Ash to take it to the local Pokémon Center. They soon discover that Bulbasaur isn’t sick—it’s getting ready to evolve!

media.title: The Case of the K-9 Caper
media.description: On their way to Cinnabar Island, our heroes join Officer Jenny and the police force’s Growlithe in some special training, hoping to improve Pikachu’s battling skills.

media.title: Pokémon Paparazzi
media.description: On a brief stop for lunch, Ash and his friends meet Todd Snap, a Pokémon photographer who has been trying to get a perfect shot of Pikachu.

media.title: The Ultimate Test
media.description: Realizing that he hasn’t won any Gym badges for a while, Ash signs up for the Pokémon League Admissions Exam, a great chance to prove he’s got what it takes to become a Pokémon Master!

media.title: The Breeding Center Secret
media.description: Ash and the gang decide to check out a breeding center that they saw on a commercial. However, the center is a cover for a diabolical scheme from Team Rocket members Butch and Cassidy—old rivals of Jessie and James!

title: Pokémon: Adventures in the Orange Islands
description: Ash’s journey to the top of the Indigo League continues—but will his friendship with fellow Pokémon League competitor Richie endanger his chances? With his Kanto journey completed, Ash finds there’s still plenty to see and do when Professor Oak sends him and his friends to the Orange Islands. Brock falls head-over-heels for the attractive Professor Ivy and decides to stay with her, leaving Ash and Misty alone as a dynamic duo—at least until they meet intrepid Pokémon watcher Tracey Sketchit!

media.title: Princess vs. Princess
media.description: Misty and Jessie compete to be Queen of the Princess Festival! Ash and Brock lend Misty their Pokémon for the battle, and Jessie takes a licking despite a surprise Pokémon of her own.

media.title: The Purr-fect Hero
media.description: It’s Kids Day, and Ash and friends help some schoolchildren celebrate. Team Rocket spoils the fun by grabbing a kid instead of Pikachu. In a shocking turn of events, Meowth becomes a good guy...or does he?

media.title: Riddle Me This
media.description: Our heroes travel to Cinnabar Island, where Ash hopes to win the Volcano Badge. A strange character offers riddles about how to find the Gym, where Ash and Pikachu have a fiery battle with a Pokémon they’ve never seen before!

media.title: Volcanic Panic
media.description: Ash has finally located the Gym, suspended above a pool of molten lava! Only a strong Fire-type Pokémon could help him in this battle for the Volcano Badge, so Ash must rely on his misbehaving Charizard.

media.title: Beach Blank-out Blastoise
media.description: As Ash and the gang are rushing to catch the last ferry off of Cinnabar Island, they get sidetracked by a group of Squirtle, Wartortle, and Blastoise who need their help!

media.title: The Misty Mermaid
media.description: Misty's Horsea is in desperate need of exercise, so the gang decides to take it to her sisters' Gym in Cerulean City. There, she learns that her sisters are planning an exciting underwater ballet.

media.title: Clefairy Tales
media.description: Ash, Brock, and Misty get sidetracked on their way to Viridian City when all of their belongings mysteriously disappear. While searching for their missing things, they find themselves mixed up in a close encounter that’s really out of this world!

media.title: The Battle of the Badge
media.description: Our heroes make their way to Viridian City, where Ash hopes to earn the Earth Badge. They get to the Gym just in time to see his rival, Gary, being defeated by an unknown Pokémon—and Gary insists that it's evil!

media.title: It’s Mr. Mime Time
media.description: On their way back to Pallet Town, our heroes encounter a runaway Mr. Mime. Ash disguises himself as another Mr. Mime so he can get close. When Team Rocket strikes, will they catch the right Mr. Mime?

media.title: Snow Way Out!
media.description: Our heroes find themselves at a fork in the road and decide to climb a steep and dangerous mountain. Pikachu gets lost, and they must all work together to find it, stay warm, and weather a storm.

media.title: Showdown at the Po-ké Corral
media.description: On a visit to Professor Oak’s house, Ash runs into Gary, and they talk about the upcoming Pokémon League. Professor Oak says they should learn from each other rather than competing, and that teamwork pays off when Team Rocket attacks!

media.title: The Evolution Solution
media.description: Ash joins his mom for a vacation on Seafoam Island. While there, he seeks out the programmer of the Pokédex to learn about the unusual Evolution of SlowPoké. This mystery is surprisingly revealed by Team Rocket's bumbling!

media.title: The Pi-Kahuna
media.description: When Ash wipes out during a surfing attempt, Victor rescues him and tells him about Humungadunga, a giant wave that sweeps through every 20 years. Can Ash and Pikachu give Victor the confidence he needs to catch the giant wave?

media.title: Make Room for Gloom!
media.description: Back in Pallet Town, Ash and friends meet Florinda, who works at the local nursery. Her Gloom won't evolve, so she’s afraid she's not training it properly. When Team Rocket attacks, everyone sees just how strong a Pokémon can become!

media.title: Lights, Camera, Quack-tion!
media.description: A famous director comes to town, and everybody wants to be the star! Since he only wants Pokémon in his movie, Ash, Brock, Misty, and Team Rocket fight hard to make sure it’s their Pokémon that will star opposite Wigglytuff.

media.title: Go West Young Meowth
media.description: When the gang attends the premiere of “Pokémon in Love,” Meowth looks back on his painful past. He shares the story of his life before Team Rocket, including how he learned to walk and talk like a human.

media.title: To Master the Onixpected
media.description: With only three weeks left before the Pokémon League competition, Ash, Brock, and Misty head up to Mt. Hideaway to find one of the Elite Four. They're after Pokémon training tips, but they discover a land of overgrown Onix instead!

media.title: The Ancient Puzzle of Pokémopolis
media.description: While Ash and Brock train for the Pokémon League, they uncover a hidden temple containing Pokémon fossils. Misty remembers a hidden city where people built temples to honor Pokémon. Could they have stumbled upon the ancient city of Pokémopolis?

media.title: Bad to the Bone
media.description: Our heroes are headed to the Pokémon League tournament at the Indigo Plateau when they meet another Trainer going their way. Unfortunately, all of his Gym badges have been stolen, so he can't compete...unless he takes Ash's badges instead!

media.title: All Fired Up!
media.description: The Pokémon League is about to begin with the ceremonial lighting of the torch, which carries a flame from the Legendary Pokémon Moltres. Of course, Team Rocket tries to steal it!

media.title: Round One—Begin!
media.description: It's the first day of the Pokémon League, and when Ash's friends learn his first battle will be held on the Water Field, they're full of advice!

media.title: Fire and Ice
media.description: As the Pokémon League continues, Ash battles on the Rock Field and has a run-in with Team Rocket after they set up a fake Pokémon Center to lure unwary Trainers!

media.title: The Fourth Round Rumble
media.description: Ash faces his toughest opponent yet on the Grass Field at the Pokémon League! Are he and his Bulbasaur ready to take on his opponent and her powerful Scyther?

media.title: A Friend in Deed
media.description: When Ash meets a like-minded Trainer named Richie at the Pokémon League, the two boys quickly become close friends—and so do their two Pikachu!

media.title: Friend and Foe Alike
media.description: In the fifth round of the Pokémon League, Ash and Richie are matched up against each other! Can their friendship withstand this important battle?

media.title: Friends to the End
media.description: Ash, Misty, and Brock are in the stands cheering for Richie as the Pokémon League winds down, and then they march together in the closing ceremonies. It's an experience that will stick with Ash throughout his journey as a Trainer!

media.title: Pallet Party Panic
media.description: Ash and friends return to Pallet Town for a hero's welcome, only to be sent on another journey right away! Professor Oak is seeking a mysterious-looking Poké Ball, and he asks Ash, Brock, and Misty to find it for him.

media.title: A Scare in the Air
media.description: Our heroes prepare for their long journey to Valencia Island to bring back a mysterious Poké Ball for Professor Oak. When Ash wins a free blimp ride, it seems their travel woes are no more—but who's flying this thing?

media.title: Pokéball Peril
media.description: After making a crash landing onto Valencia Island, our heroes get directions to Professor Ivy’s laboratory, where the mysterious Poké Ball is being held. Brock is delighted to discover that the professor and her colleagues are fellow Pokémon breeders

media.title: The Lost Lapras
media.description: Thanks to Jigglypuff's sleep-inducing song, the blimp carrying Ash and Misty back home goes off course and crashes on an island, where they meet a new friend named Tracey while trying to help a lost Lapras.

media.title: Fit to Be Tide
media.description: Ash, Misty, and Tracey set out to explore the Orange Islands, and Ash is determined to qualify for the Orange League! He soon learns that the Orange Crew challenges are a little different from the usual Gym battles.

media.title: Pikachu Re-Volts
media.description: When Ash, Misty, and Tracey arrive on Mandarin Island, Pikachu and Togepi turn against them and join a group of other angry Pokémon. When the misbehaving Pokémon disappear, Officer Jenny informs them that dozens of Pokémon have been reported missing!

media.title: The Crystal Onix
media.description: Ash finds a message in a bottle, which leads our heroes to a new adventure on Sunburst Island and a search for a very special Onix!

media.title: In the Pink
media.description: Our heroes find themselves on Pinkan Island, home to a large number of strangely colored Pokémon. Ash and Tracey are fascinated by these pink Pokémon…and so are the Team Rocket trio!

media.title: Shell Shock!
media.description: After joining a scientific expedition to investigate a Kabuto fossil, Ash and friends soon find themselves facing a series of natural disasters!

media.title: Bye, Bye Psyduck
media.description: Another Water-type specialist challenges Misty to a battle and offers some advice: she thinks Misty's Psyduck might be ready to evolve!

media.title: The Joy of Pokémon
media.description: Our heroes meet a very busy Nurse Joy who has to do some serious island-hopping to take care of all the Pokémon in the area! Can they help protect her from Team Rocket?

media.title: Navel Maneuvers
media.description: In Ash's second challenge against the Orange Crew, he must climb a mountain, build a bobsled, and win a sled race! Do his Pokémon have what it takes to help him through these obstacles?

media.title: Snack Attack
media.description: Our heroes' explorations take them to the seven Grapefruit Islands, where they learn that the islands' famous fruit has been disappearing! Ash, Misty, and Tracey set out to catch whoever's responsible.

media.title: A Shipful of Shivers
media.description: When divers recover an ancient Orange League Championship trophy, our heroes head straight for the art museum where it's on display to check it out! Unfortunately, Team Rocket has beaten them to the punch…

media.title: Meowth Rules!
media.description: When Team Rocket crashes on an island, Meowth is the center of attention when the locals mistake him for the "Great Meowth of Bounty," a powerful creature spoken of in prophecy. What will happen when they learn the truth?

media.title: Tracey Gets Bugged
media.description: Misty is not pleased when our heroes land on an island swarming with Bug-type Pokémon, though Ash and Tracey are having a blast. When they find an injured Scyther, can Misty overcome her disgust and help out?

media.title: A Way Off Day Off
media.description: When Ash and friends find a wonderful island brimming with many kinds of fruit trees, they decide to take a break and enjoy the bounty! Of course, Team Rocket has other ideas…

media.title: Wherefore Art Thou, Pokémon?
media.description: Our heroes meet a couple of Trainers who don't seem to get along at all, even though their Nidoran are obviously smitten with each other. Misty is determined to solve this romantic challenge!

media.title: Get Along, Little Pokémon
media.description: Slogging through a thunderstorm, our heroes notice a group of Magnemite soaking up electricity from the lightning bolts. When they finally get into town to rest, there's a blackout! Can the Magnemite help?

media.title: The Mystery Menace
media.description: In Trovitopolis City, Ash and friends hear stories about some kind of monster that's been scaring everyone—and when the ground cracks open and dumps them in the sewer, it seems they might meet this monster face to face!

media.title: Misty Meets Her Match
media.description: After Misty dives into a whirlpool to rescue a girl, she learns that the girl's brother, Rudy, has a giant crush on her. Things get more complicated when it turns out he's also the Gym Leader Ash must challenge next!

media.title: Bound for Trouble
media.description: Ash and friends go in search of super-sized Pokémon, but when they fall for a Team Rocket trick, and then Pikachu and Meowth get snatched up by a giant Pidgeot, everyone must work together to get them back!

media.title: Charizard Chills
media.description: After hearing about Ash from the Trovita Island Gym Leader, another Trainer seeks him out for a battle...and after Pikachu is knocked out, Ash turns to his Charizard. But can he get the unruly Pokémon to listen to him?

media.title: The Pokémon Water War
media.description: Our heroes’ plans are interrupted by a raging fire in a nearby warehouse. When they try to fight the flames, they quickly find themselves in need of the local fire department: Team Wartortle!

media.title: Pokémon Food Fight
media.description: When Snorlax's Poké Ball breaks, Ash has a huge problem on his hands: How can our heroes get the slumbering Snorlax over a mountain pass to the nearest Pokémon Center?

media.title: Pokémon Double Trouble
media.description: Ash is anxious to win the final badge of the Orange League, and soon gets a taste of this Gym Leader’s strength as she helps him fend off another Team Rocket sneak attack!

media.title: The Wacky Watcher
media.description: Discovering a scientist’s submarine at sea, our heroes are soon surrounded by his life’s research: a school of splashing Magikarp! They want to help him study Magikarp Evolution, but Team Rocket has other ideas…

media.title: The Stun Spore Detour
media.description: With Ash and Tracey paralyzed by a wild Vileplume’s Stun Spore, it’s up to Misty to find a local plant and save the day!

media.title: Hello Pummelo
media.description: With his four Orange League badges in hand, Ash has one last challenge to face before he can be crowned Champion of the Orange League. Does he have what it takes?

media.title: Enter The Dragonite
media.description: Ash’s battle for the Orange League Winner’s Trophy rages on, and it soon becomes apparent that he will have to take on a powerful Dragonite to become the Orange League Champion!

media.title: Viva Las Lapras
media.description: Trying to rescue a local school of Lapras from would-be poachers, our heroes must find a way to convince these distrustful Pokémon they are friends...before it’s too late!

media.title: The Underground Round Up
media.description: With Pallet Town on their minds, our heroes are searching for a ferry, but soon discover the port is abandoned...except for some explosive Electrode! Can Ash stop Team Rocket before the ferry goes up in smoke?

media.title: The Tent Situation
media.description: Ash has an eventful homecoming with a surprise visit from an old friend, a visit to see Professor Oak, and a Team Rocket raid. There’s no place like home!

media.title: A Rivalry Revival
media.description: After Gary comes to the rescue against Team Rocket, Ash seizes an opportunity…at long last, our hero gets to challenge his rival to their very first Pokémon battle!

title: Pokémon: The Johto Journeys
description: The Orange League beckons and Ash answers the call, taking on the Orange Crew and their leader, Drake. Upon returning to Pallet Town, Ash and Misty reunite with Brock and set out on the next stage of their Pokémon journey—the Johto region! Though he still has an errand to run for Professor Oak, Ash jumps with both feet into the Johto League, taking on a couple of Gym Leaders and adding Pokémon like Totodile and Chikorita to his team.

media.title: Don't Touch That 'Dile!
media.description: Ash begins his journey in Johto, a region largely unexplored and populated with Pokémon entirely new to him and his friends.

media.title: The Double Trouble Header!
media.description: On the road again, Ash and his Charizard soundly defeat an ambitious rookie Trainer named Casey. Upset, she runs away before Ash can comfort her—the perfect time for Team Rocket to strike!

media.title: A Sappy Ending!
media.description: In a forest that's being destroyed by rampaging Pinsir, Ash has to enlist the help of the local Heracross to protect their home! But it turns out these Pokémon look tougher than they act…

media.title: Roll On, Pokémon!
media.description: On their way to Violet City, our heroes arrive in a valley where Donphan are used to harvest precious stones. Needless to say, the Team Rocket villains aren't far behind them!

media.title: Illusion Confusion!
media.description: The forest can be a scary place at night, especially when you’re lost! Our heroes will need some help to get out of this mess. It's Hoothoot to the rescue!

media.title: Flower Power!
media.description: On their first stop in a city since New Bark Town, our heroes decide to help an insecure Bellossom dance troupe regain their confidence and perform in an upcoming exhibition!

media.title: Spinarak Attack!
media.description: Ash and the gang arrive in a town besieged by apparent copycat crimes mimicking a legendary master thief. The town’s hopes lie with these young Trainers...how can they stop this criminal duo and their Meowth accomplice?

media.title: Snubbull Snobbery!
media.description: When our heroes return an unhappy Snubbull to its wealthy Trainer, it sparks off a series of events that will change the Pokémon’s life forever!

media.title: The Little Big Horn!
media.description: When Brock discovers a hurt and frightened Stantler in a nearby park, he decides to nurse it back to health. But with Jessie, James and Meowth on his case, can he keep Stantler safe?

media.title: Chikorita Rescue!
media.description: Still on the road to Violet City, Ash encounters a wild Chikorita and tries to catch it. Chikorita proves to be a tougher opponent than he originally thought, and things only get worse when Team Rocket arrives…

media.title: Once In A Blue Moon!
media.description: Professor Oak’s errand to deliver the mysterious GS Ball to a Poké Ball expert is interrupted when a Quagsire with an eye for round objects steals the GS Ball for a nocturnal ritual…

media.title: The Whistle Stop!
media.description: Under yet another Team Rocket ambush, a young Trainer and her Ledyba help our heroes see them off. But, amidst the chaos, her Ledyba get separated from the group—where could they be?

media.title: Ignorance is Blissey!
media.description: Our heroes make a rest stop in a Pokémon Center, which is run by a kind-hearted but misguided Blissey. Things only get worse when an old friend of Blissey's drops in unexpectedly…

media.title: A Bout With Sprout!
media.description: Finally reaching Violet City, Ash’s search for the Gym is halted by a trip to the local Pokémon Academy. Ash does well playing teacher, until one pupil takes off with Pikachu!

media.title: Fighting Flyer With Fire!
media.description: It’s finally time for Ash’s first Johto League Gym battle, and he’s feeling confident. But Falkner’s Flying-type Pokémon prove to be tough competition! Can Ash take the win—and his first Gym badge?

media.title: For Crying Out Loud!
media.description: Back on the road after his first Johto Gym badge win, Ash and the gang find a cute Marill that won’t stop crying! Nothing our heroes try will stop it, and a Team Rocket raid certainly won’t help!

media.title: Tanks A Lot!
media.description: Team Rocket’s latest invention is bound to be a hit...until Togepi and its newfound Sentret friend take it out for a spin!

media.title: Charizard's Burning Ambitions!
media.description: Ash hears of a training ground for wild Charizard and decides it's just the place to hone his own Charizard’s strength. But the tough lessons to be learned there will change Ash and Charizard’s friendship forever!

media.title: Grin To Win!
media.description: Back on the road to the Azalea Gym, our heroes discover a Sunflora festival in a nearby town and meet a Trainer whose Sunflora is too sad to compete. Can Ash and the gang put a smile on its face?

media.title: Chikorita's Big Upset!
media.description: Ash is having a hard time getting his Chikorita to listen to him, and Nurse Joy thinks that it’s due to a bout of jealousy over Ash’s friendship with Pikachu! Can Ash prove how much Chikorita means to him?

media.title: Foul Weather Friends!
media.description: Our heroes meet a Trainer whose Hoppip partners can predict the weather. But on the horizon, there are two storms approaching...and one of them goes by the name “Team Rocket”!

media.title: The Superhero Secret!
media.description: The legendary superhero Gligarman grows old and is beginning to consider hanging up his cape. When Ash and friends wander into town, they bring with them a challenge that could be his final fight: Team Rocket!

media.title: Mild 'n Wooly!
media.description: When an unruly herd of Mareep ruin their lunch plans, our heroes decide to help their timid herder in time to compete in a local battle festival.

media.title: Wired For Battle!
media.description: When the top student at a Pokémon training center loses interest in Pokémon battles, opting to build a comprehensive Pokémon database instead, it’s up to Ash to convince him that battling is not just about probability!

media.title: Good 'Quil Hunting!
media.description: When Ash finds a Cyndaquil in the wild, he is eager to catch it...but you can bet he’s not the only one!

media.title: A Shadow Of A Drought!
media.description: Arriving in Azalea Town, Ash carelessly provokes its residents, who adore Slowpoke. And things only look worse as Team Rocket arrives, meaning to snag every last Slowpoke! What can Ash do?

media.title: Going Apricorn!
media.description: As he promised Professor Oak, Ash delivers the mysterious GS Ball to a renowned Poké Ball expert. But the fruits of his labor are almost spoiled when Team Rocket bursts onto the scene!

media.title: Gettin' the Bugs Out!
media.description: Ash has finally reached the Azalea Gym, but Cyndaquil isn’t quite fired up enough to take on the Gym Leader. As the battle heats up, Ash has to give his all to take on the powerful Bug-type Pokémon!

media.title: A Farfetch'd Tale!
media.description: An inexperienced young Trainer has managed to scare off his own Farfetch’d. Our heroes are happy to help him out, but they'll have to find it before Team Rocket does!

media.title: Tricks Of The Trade!
media.description: At an annual Pokémon trading festival, a young Trainer is looking for a good trade for his Wobbuffet. The Team Rocket trio are looking for opportunities as well, but both sets of Trainers get more than they bargain for!

media.title: The Fire-ing Squad!
media.description: An unexpected Pokémon firefighting competition reunites our heroes with some old friends, the Squirtle Squad! But they are in desperate need of some leadership, so Ash and Squirtle rejoin the ranks.

media.title: No Big Woop!
media.description: When they stumble upon a preschool for Wooper and an emergency calls the teacher away, our heroes come to the rescue! But, as always, Team Rocket is around the corner and up to no good…

media.title: Tunnel Vision!
media.description: On the way to Goldenrod City, our heroes are forced to head through a tunnel guarded by angry Onix. To make it more difficult, Team Rocket, Snubbull, and Jigglypuff drop in for a visit…

media.title: Hour Of The Houndour!
media.description: Following a string of mysterious thefts, our heroes discover some Houndour struggling to survive in the wild. To help these thieving Pokémon mend their ways, Ash and friends will first have to earn their trust.

media.title: The Totodile Duel!
media.description: Ash and Misty’s rivalry is reignited when they both try to capture a Totodile at the same time. Unable to see whose Poké Ball actually caught it, they decide a battle is the best way to decide Totodile’s new Trainer.

media.title: Hot Matches!
media.description: When Ash hears of a virtually unbeatable Trainer nearby, he's itching to take on the challenge. But both Brock’s Vulpix and Ash’s Cyndaquil take a beating from her Skarmory, even with their type advantage! How can Ash defeat it?

media.title: Love, Totodile Style!
media.description: Ash’s Totodile develops a crush on a passing Azumarill, the star performer of a Pokémon circus. When Team Rocket arrives to steal the show, Azumarill’s heart isn't the only thing Totodile has to win!

media.title: Fowl Play!
media.description: Ash has his sights set on a rare Noctowl with unusual coloring, but this clever Pokémon repeatedly uses Hypnosis to get the better of him! Will Ash be able to catch this Noctowl napping?

media.title: Forest Grumps!
media.description: A surprise attack from a group of Ursaring has our heroes and Team Rocket running for cover. In the chaos, the groups are split up, and the unenthusiastic pairings are forced to work together. But for how long?

media.title: The Psychic Sidekicks!
media.description: After seeing a sign in the forest warning them about mischievous Ghost-type Pokémon, our heroes reach a town whose residents use Psychic types to repel them. But soon some spooky news arrives: a giant Gengar is on the loose!

media.title: The Fortune Hunters!
media.description: A sudden craze in Pokémon fortune-telling turns out to be a plot to steal Pokémon from local Trainers. But Jessie, James and Meowth aren't behind it this time! Who are these con artists?

title: Pokémon: Johto League Champions
description: From the sprawling metropolis of Goldenrod City to the icy peak of Snowtop Mountain, the Johto region presents Ash, Misty, and Brock with exciting new adventures—along with a few familiar faces like their old friends Todd, Duplica, and Suzie! Johto’s rich past means plenty of Pokémon mysteries for our heroes to solve, and its exciting present means some tough challenges—Ash tackles three more Gyms, while handling competitions like the Pokémon Sumo Conference along the way.

media.title: A Goldenrod Opportunity
media.description: Arriving in Goldenrod City, Ash is ready for his next Gym battle, but the Gym appears to be closed. Their plans delayed, our heroes decide to explore the vibrant city.

media.title: A Dairy Tale Ending
media.description: After losing to Whitney at the Goldenrod Gym, Ash is thinking of a rematch with her powerful Miltank. When Whitney suggests a trip to a Miltank dairy, it’s just the chance he's looking for!

media.title: Air Time
media.description: With his new Gym badge in hand, Ash is asked to appear on a local radio station. But while he's acting out a radio drama with some “professional actors,” the scripted danger becomes all too lifelike!

media.title: The Bug Stops Here
media.description: A Bug Pokémon Catching Contest turns into a hive of activity when Ash goes up against his rival Casey—and it isn’t long before the Team Rocket villains swarm the scene, intent on catching a few things for themselves…

media.title: Type Casting!
media.description: On the way to Ecruteak City, our heroes are trapped on the wrong side of a river. To get across, they first have to find a Sudowoodo...which, even for an expert, is no easy feat!

media.title: Fossil Fools
media.description: When an ex-student of Professor Oak’s discovers some restored Omanyte and Omastar in the wild, our heroes are called into action to save these prehistoric Pokémon from harsh times with Team Rocket!

media.title: Carrying On
media.description: The Pidgey Express courier service is in need of our heroes' helping hands, especially when Team Rocket wants to have the delivery Pidgey signed, sealed, and delivered to the Boss!

media.title: Hassle in the Castle
media.description: Caught in a sudden downpour, our heroes find a castle clinic that uses Pokémon healers to help patients. But when Brock and the doctor end up trapped in the castle's labyrinth, a helping hand is needed to get them out!

media.title: Two Hits and a Miss
media.description: After meeting the elderly owner of a Pokémon dojo, Ash is called upon to replace the man's granddaughter as the chosen heir! But when a vicious challenger approaches, can Ash help defend the dojo from destruction?

media.title: A Hot Water Battle
media.description: Chikorita, Cyndaquil, and Totodile find themselves separated from the group and stuck in a ravine! When Meowth finds himself stuck too, an unlikely partnership forms!

media.title: Hook, Line and Stinker
media.description: Misty is reeled into a rivalry at a local Seaking fishing competition. Can she come out on top?

media.title: Beauty and the Breeder
media.description: A Pokémon breeding contest gives our heroes a chance to compete, greet an old friend, and defeat Team Rocket once again!

media.title: A Better Pill to Swallow
media.description: When Ash comes down with a serious stomachache far from any hospital, a local healer and his Shuckle companions are on task to set him right!

media.title: Power Play
media.description: A run-in with his longtime rival Gary leaves Ash in a bad mood. But when Team Rocket’s latest weapon starts terrorizing the local Pokémon Center, Ash might have to turn to him for help!
